strings.Value: "Could you perhaps speak a bit more slowly?"

{n}The tiefling girl looks as though she's made of springs: she cannot stand still for a moment. She nods her head, snaps her fingers, and taps her feet to an inner, whirling song. Seeing you, she quickly waves her hand and breaks into a wide smile – and immediately starts jabbering:{/n} "{mf|Y'grace!|Y'grace!|Y'highness!|Y'highness!} Welcome! Whad ya want? Scrolls? I have 'em! Ya won't regret it!"

{mf|Y'grace!|Y'grace!|Y'highness!|Y'highness!} Lookie, lookie! I gotta... This here! Scrolls! New! They're ter-rif-fic!" {n}Laughing, she slaps her bag.{/n} "And it's all thanks to you! Since ya started opening them libraries and improving learnin' 'round these parts, mages from all over mobbed the place! And the more mages, the more demand – and more goodies for you!"
"You'll be back, I know it!" {n}The girl waves her hand laughing.{/n}

"Zarcie the Letter Gobbler, at yer service!" {n}The girl bows with a wide smile.{/n} "Best spells, charms, jinxes and hexes for the best {mf|baron|baroness|King|Queen} across all the River Kingdoms! Buy it all – and don't be stingy. Ya won't regret it!"
"It's a family business! I've got siblings across all Mendev! They pinch every... Eh, I mean, they're very creative suppliers! And I sell it all! Get it now! Don't hesitate! My goodies're gre-e-eat!"

"My suppliers'll bring more scrolls for sale, if ya manage to attract more mages to yer lands! More mages – more demand – and more goodies for you! So go build them libraries, and we'll both profit from it!"
